posts.content: It's a pretty straightforward & solid build actually, the split is "Fighter 10/ Rogue OR Bard 4/ Blackguard 16". But it will be of little use if you get sacrificed again, so choose the correct side this time.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You have to play a Human for the build to work properly but the good news are that he not only has a bastard sword, but all the divine feats he could get on, as well. Fighter instead of Rogue in the beginning was chosen because of playability so you can start with all necessary feats immediately. Both Charisma and Strength are main stats for you and you must take care to max them if possible (including temporal buffs through umd) for best results. Your saving throws with buffed Charisma are very high and so is your armour class, and damage is excellent. This is an advanced build however and to get the best out of it, you need to use your abilities, such as Divine Might/ Shield, Expertise/ Taunt and Improved Knockdown to name a few. The tools are there, but you need to know how to use them. I suspect however, being in the (correct?) side this time, will give you enough time for this.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Good build, Val!

You should start with 18 STR and 17 CHA for +1 AB from level 1. Divine Feats and BG only come way later, so no reason to start with 17 STR and 18 CHA.

Only other tweak I'd suggest here and only as a 50-50 kind of personal preference tweak is to drop 2 Great Strengths for Epic Fiendish Servant (I know it's shit but could help a lot for generating sneak attacks) OR Epic Fortitude (for insta-death spells) and Epic Skill Focus: Discipline. Having 42 Discipline you won't necessarily be upright a lot, especially fighting high-AB meleers or Battle Cleric toons. I think a fairly safe number for you to be sure you'll stay upright would be around 50.

A dedicated meleer will have 25 BAB + 8 STR, + 4 WF/EWF/EP = 37. That is with absolutely no STR, Weapon and other enhancements. You could get up to +6 on your discipline with STR increases and that's it, they could get +6 from STR to AB as well, plus weapon enhancements such as GMW for another +5 which brings them exactly to your Discipline total, add Bless, Aid, Prayer and debuffs, and you probably will get KDed. Hell, even 51 Discipline doesn't sound that safe anymore. I think ESF: Discipline is a must for this guy.

Take it EZ!

Youe first suggestion is good Max, gives 1 ab for a couple of levels earlier, i won't edit the build because of the known forum problems, but do as Max said and instead go (at 4th lvl) for +1 cha/ then everything to str after that.

The second one, it has it's merits and i would take the esf in it, except this character can get his AC so high, that most of his opponents attacks won't hit him, and if we factor improved invisibility through umd and expertise, the chances to get hit are pretty slim. Anyway if he really needs that much discipline (58 instead of 48) then he could start with Str 18/ Con 12/ Cha 18 and take Esf: Discipline instead of the first Great STR and there you have it. That would mean -30 Hp's & -1 Fort though.
